result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric D. Dickrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
No contact with Bobbi Jo Pliska unless she consents in writing and the agent approves.
Participate in any other assessment and counseling recommended by the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric D. Dickrell in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF60, 15CF127
3:09 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
State files amended information in 15CF60.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Sheets received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. Victim is not present. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF60 Counts 2, 3 & 4 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF60 Counts 2, 3 & 4 of the amended information.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.
15CF60 Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.  
15CF127 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF60 Count 3 - 
30 days jail
3 days credit
Huber for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Allowed to serve half on electronic monitoring, if he qualifies. 
Allowed to transfer to another county if arrangments can be made. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days. 

15CF60 Count 2 - 
150 days jail, Consecutive to Count 3 - STAYED
2 days credit
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years: 
No contact with Bobbi Jo Pliska unless she consents in writing and the agent approves. 
Participate in any other assessment and counseling recommended by the agent.
Pay costs including the DNA and Domestic Abuse surcharges. 

15CF60 Count 4 -
150 days jail, concurrent to Count 2 - STAYED
2 days credit
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Pay costs including the DNA Surcharge. 
Comply with all conditions of probation listed in Count 2.

Atty Sheets requests 3 days jail credit. 
Atty Cousins makes arguments.

Pre-trial conference at 07-20-2015 08:30 am
Defendant Record Update

All other conditions remain in effect. 
No contact Bobby Joe Pliska  or her residence.

State files Information.

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Atty Sheets makes statements re: the defendant obtaining personal items. 
Bond Continued.
